q: What annotation is used to mark a class as a service in Spring?
Which annotation enables automatic dependency injection?
What is the purpose of the service layer in Spring?
The ______ annotation marks a class as a Spring service.
Which annotation is used for automatic dependency injection?
Constructor injection is the recommended way for mandatory dependencies.
What is the output of this code?
The ______ injection is recommended for mandatory dependencies.
What is field injection in Spring?
What is the output of this code?
The ______ annotation injects dependencies into fields.
Field injection is less testable than constructor injection.
Setter injection is used for optional dependencies.
The ______ injection is used for optional dependencies.
What is the difference between @Autowired and @Inject?
What annotation is used to qualify which bean to inject?
The ______ annotation specifies which bean to inject when multiple exist.

o: Marks bean as default when multiple candidates exist

q: @Primary marks a bean as default when multiple candidates exist.
What is the purpose of @Transactional annotation?
@Transactional can be used at class and method level.
What is the default propagation for @Transactional?
The default propagation for @Transactional is REQUIRED.

o: Uses existing transaction or creates new one

q: What is the output of this code?
The ______ propagation uses existing or creates new transaction.
REQUIRES_NEW suspends the current transaction if one exists.

o: Uses transaction if exists, otherwise non-transactional

q: The ______ propagation always creates a new transaction.

o: Must have existing transaction or throws exception

q: Propagation.MANDATORY throws exception if no transaction exists.

o: Degree to which transaction is isolated from others

q: What is the default isolation level in Spring?
The ______ isolation level is the database default.
The ______ isolation is the strictest level.
SERIALIZABLE can impact performance due to locking.
Match isolation levels with what they prevent:
What is transaction rollback in Spring?
@Transactional rolls back on runtime exceptions by default.
The ______ attribute specifies which exceptions cause rollback.
Checked exceptions do not trigger rollback by default.

o: Rolls back on any exception including checked
Rolls back only on runtime exceptions
Specifies exceptions that should not cause rollback

q: The ______ attribute prevents rollback for specified exceptions.

o: Maximum time for transaction to complete

q: The timeout attribute specifies maximum transaction duration.

o: Hints that transaction only reads data

q: The ______ attribute hints that transaction is read-only.
readOnly=true can improve performance for read operations.

o: Marks all methods as read-only transactions

q: The ______ annotation defines bean lifecycle scope.
The default bean scope in Spring is singleton.

o: New instance created each time bean is requested

q: The ______ scope creates a new instance each time.
Prototype beans are not managed after creation.
What is lazy initialization in Spring?
o: Bean created only when first accessed

q: The ______ annotation delays bean creation until first use.

o: Loads cache on each method call

q: The ______ annotation marks method to run after construction.
@PreDestroy method runs before bean is destroyed.
ApplicationContext is the Spring IoC container.
The ______ annotation binds properties to a class.

o: Binds app.mail.* properties to the class

q: The ______ propagation suspends current transaction and runs without one.
Propagation.NEVER throws exception if active transaction exists.
The ______ propagation creates a savepoint for partial rollback.
NESTED allows partial rollback using savepoints.
What is dirty read in database transactions?
o: Reading uncommitted data from another transaction

q: A dirty read occurs when uncommitted changes are visible.

o: Same query returns different results within transaction

q: The ______ phenomenon occurs when data changes between reads.

o: New rows appear in subsequent queries

q: Phantom reads involve newly inserted rows appearing.
AOP is used for logging, security, and transactions.
What is an Aspect in AOP?
The ______ annotation marks a class as an aspect.
What is a Pointcut in AOP?
Pointcuts use expressions to match joinpoints.
The ______ is the code that runs at matched joinpoints.
@Before advice executes before the target method.
The ______ annotation marks advice to run before target.

o: Runs after target method regardless of outcome

q: @After advice runs after method regardless of exception.
The ______ advice runs only when method completes successfully.

o: Most powerful, controls entire method execution

q: The ______ advice can control whether target method executes.
@Around advice must call proceed() to invoke target.

o: Point in code where advice can be applied

q: JoinPoint provides information about the target method.
The ______ provides access to method arguments in advice.

o: JoinPoint that allows invoking target method

q: ProceedingJoinPoint is used only in @Around advice.
The ______ pattern is used for loose coupling via events.
What interface publishes events in Spring?
The ______ annotation marks method as event listener.
@EventListener methods are called synchronously by default.

o: Sends notification when order is created

q: What annotation makes event listener async?
The ______ annotation makes event processing asynchronous.

o: Listens for events within transaction phases

q: The ______ annotation binds event handling to transaction phases.
The ______ annotation enables scheduled task execution.

o: Fixed time between start of each execution

q: fixedRate measures from start to start of each execution.

o: Fixed delay between end and next start

q: The ______ measures time from completion to next start.
Cron expressions allow complex scheduling patterns.
The ______ attribute accepts cron expressions for scheduling.
What is request scope in Spring?
Request scope means one instance per HTTP request.
The ______ scope creates one bean per user session.
Application scope is similar to singleton but ServletContext-aware.

o: Programmatic access to beans on demand
Gets new processor instance on each call

q: The ______ interface provides programmatic bean access.
execution() is the most common pointcut designator.
The ______ designator matches method execution joinpoints.
@annotation matching finds methods with given annotation.

c:
@Pointcut("@annotation(com.example.Logged)")
public void loggedMethods() {}

q: The ______ designator matches methods with specific annotation.
What does within() pointcut designator match?
The ______ designator matches types with specific annotation.
What does args() pointcut designator match?
args(String, ..) matches methods with first arg as String.
What does bean() pointcut designator match?
o: Bean with specific name or pattern

q: The ______ designator is Spring-specific for matching beans.

c:
@Pointcut("bean(*Service)")
public void serviceBeans() {}
o: All beans with names ending in Service

q: Pointcut expressions can be combined with && and ||.
What does this combined pointcut match?
c:
@Pointcut("execution(* *(..)) && @annotation(Transactional)")
public void transactionalMethods() {}

q: @Retryable enables automatic method retry on exception.

o: Retries up to 3 times on RemoteServiceException
Fallback method after all retries fail

q: The ______ annotation marks fallback method for failed retries.
The ______ annotation caches method return values.
@Cacheable skips method execution if cached value exists.
What does key attribute in @Cacheable specify?
SpEL can be used for cache key expressions.
What does condition attribute in @Cacheable do?
What does unless attribute in @Cacheable do?
o: Prevents caching when condition is true

q: unless can access the return value via #result.
The ______ annotation removes entries from cache.

o: Clears all entries in the cache

q: The ______ annotation combines multiple caching annotations.
What cache providers does Spring support?
What is the default cache in Spring Boot?
The ______ is used as default cache when no provider configured.

o: Executes both operations in one transaction

q: PlatformTransactionManager is the core transaction interface.
The ______ is used for JDBC transactions.
@Conditional controls bean registration based on conditions.

o: Creates bean if property matches value

q: The ______ creates bean based on property value.

o: Creates bean only if not already defined
Creates bean only if specified bean exists

q: The ______ creates bean when dependent bean exists.

o: Creates bean if class is on classpath

q: The ______ annotation activates beans for specific environments.

o: Bean active only in production profile

q: Multiple profiles can be specified with @Profile.
How do you activate profiles in Spring Boot?

o: Active when production profile is NOT active

q: The ______ annotation controls bean initialization order.
@DependsOn ensures specified beans are initialized first.

o: Specifies order among multiple beans of same type

q: BeanPostProcessor can modify bean after creation.
What is the difference between BeanPostProcessor and BeanFactoryPostProcessor?
o: Factory modifies definitions, Post modifies instances

q: The ______ modifies bean definitions before instantiation.
The ______ callback is for cleanup before destruction.
ApplicationRunner.run() is called after context refresh.

o: Runs code with command line args

q: The ______ receives arguments as string array.
What is the difference between ApplicationRunner and CommandLineRunner?
o: ApplicationRunner uses ApplicationArguments, CommandLineRunner uses String[]
Advanced lifecycle with phases and auto-startup

q: What does isAutoStartup() in SmartLifecycle control?
The ______ method returns startup phase number.

o: Non-blocking transaction handling for reactive streams
Manages transactions for reactive methods returning Mono/Flux

q: TransactionalOperator is the reactive equivalent of TransactionTemplate.

o: Wraps save operation in reactive transaction
Future with users that completes asynchronously

q: The ______ wrapper allows async methods to return values.
What does getAsyncExecutor() in AsyncConfigurer do?
The ______ method provides exception handler for async.

o: Thread pool with 5 core, 10 max threads, 25 queue

q: Spring Integration implements Enterprise Integration Patterns.
What is MessageChannel in Spring Integration?
o: Pipe for passing messages between components

q: SpEL can access beans, properties, and call methods.
The ______ syntax is used for SpEL expressions.
What is the difference between ${} and #{}?

c:
@Value("#{systemProperties['user.home']}")
private String userHome;

o: Method injection for prototype into singleton
Gets new Command prototype each time

q: What is proxy mode in Spring?
o: How Spring creates proxies for beans

q: Spring uses proxies for @Transactional and AOP.
What are the two proxy modes in Spring?
The ______ creates proxies using class subclassing.
JDK dynamic proxy requires interface implementation.
What is self-invocation problem in Spring?
The ______ interface provides bean's own name.

o: Prevents cascading failures by failing fast

q: Circuit breaker has three states: closed, open, half-open.
The ______ library provides circuit breaker for Spring.
Open circuit breaker immediately returns fallback.
What is half-open state in circuit breaker?
o: Allows limited calls to test recovery

q: The ______ state allows testing if service recovered.
@RateLimiter prevents too many calls in time period.
The ______ pattern isolates failures by limiting concurrency.
The ______ pattern looks up dependencies dynamically.
Dependency Injection is preferred over Service Locator.
What does & prefix do with FactoryBean?
o: Gets the factory itself instead of created bean

q: The ______ prefix gets factory bean instead of product.
SpelExpressionParser is the standard SpEL parser.
StandardEvaluationContext is default context for SpEL.
SpEL supports safe navigation with ?. operator.
What does ?. operator do in SpEL?
The ______ operator prevents NullPointerException in SpEL.
What is Elvis operator in SpEL?
Elvis operator (?:) provides default value for null.
What does T() operator do in SpEL?
o: References Java type for static methods

q: The ______ operator accesses static methods in SpEL.
What does this SpEL expression do?
c: T(java.lang.Math).random()

q: What is collection selection in SpEL?
The ______ syntax filters collection elements in SpEL.

o: Projects name property from each element
Bean A depends on B, B depends on A

q: The ______ problem occurs when beans depend on each other.
What event is published on context startup?
ContextRefreshedEvent fires when context is refreshed.
What event fires on context close?
The ______ event fires before context closes.
The ______ loads i18n messages from properties.
What resource prefixes does Spring support?

o: Loads matching resources from all JARs

q: classpath*: scans all JARs for matching resources.
The ______ provides type conversion in Spring.
The ______ converts between multiple type pairs.
Formatter extends Printer and Parser interfaces.
DevTools provides automatic restart on changes.
DevTools is automatically disabled in production.
What is remote debugging in DevTools?
Actuator provides health checks and metrics.
How to expose all actuator endpoints?
Micrometer is the metrics facade for Spring Boot.
What metrics types does Micrometer support?

o: Point-in-time value that can go up or down

q: The ______ reports current value like memory usage.

o: Measures duration and count of events

q: Timer tracks both duration and count.
What monitoring systems does Micrometer support?

o: Whether app is ready to receive traffic

q: Readiness probe checks if app can handle requests.

o: Whether app is alive and running

q: The ______ state indicates if app should be restarted.
Liveness probe determines if app needs restart.
What is graceful shutdown in Spring Boot?
The ______ shutdown waits for requests to complete.
Graceful shutdown is enabled via server.shutdown=graceful.

o: Loads full application context for testing

q: The ______ annotation replaces bean with mock.
@SpyBean allows partial mocking of real bean.
